channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Jake Davison named as gunman who killed five
item.description: Jake Davison is suspected to have killed five people before turning the gun on himself.

item.title: James Markham killing: Boy, 14, charged with murder
item.description: A 14-year-old boy will appear in youth court charged with murdering James Markham.

item.title: Marble Arch Mound: Deputy leader resigns amid spiralling costs
item.description: Westminster Council's Melvyn Caplan steps down after total costs nearly doubled to £6m.

item.title: Jomaa Jerrare: Murder arrests after Perton lay-by body find
item.description: Two suspects are detained following the discovery of Jomaa Jerrare's badly burned remains.

item.title: Privately owned e-scooters 'should be legal on roads'
item.description: Tony Mumford died a week after crashing the e-scooter his partner Cheryl Evans gave to him.

item.title: Bolton woman inspired to create Muslim hiking group
item.description: Amira Patel says more women should be encouraged to become confident walking in the wild.

item.title: Channel migrants: French prosecutors investigate death
item.description: French authorities launch a manslaughter investigation after a migrant dies.

item.title: Somerset mum creates dream prom for child with rare disease
item.description: Kiera's mother wanted her to be able to enjoy a school prom before she embarks on further treatment.

item.title: M4 near Langley and Slough to close for further smart motorway work
item.description: The weekend closure between junctions five and six will last until Monday, Highways England says.

item.title: Builder fleeced vulnerable victims out of £100,000
item.description: George Allen is described by a judge as a "dyed-in-the-wool fraudster"

item.title: Head-bangers emotional at festival's rebirth
item.description: Last year's edition had to take place online, but head-bangers are enjoying the big comeback.

item.title: Bomb threat arrest at Northampton police station caught on film
item.description: A man is seen being tackled to the ground by officers after claiming he had a bomb in a bag.

item.title: Kane, Southgate and Sterling mural in Nuneaton nets £10,000
item.description: The three lions on the wall painting in Nuneaton helps to fund seven defibrillators.

item.title: Covid-19 testing 'mega lab' officially opens in Leamington Spa
item.description: The Leamington Spa facility has already processed about 300,000 coronavirus tests.

item.title: Success for women's skateboarding group after Olympic triumph
item.description: Team GB's Olympic skateboarders inspire new interest in Leeds all-female skateboarding group.

item.title: Blind couple refused entry by Leicester Square restaurants
item.description: Siobhan Meade and her husband were turned away from two Leicester Square restaurants.

item.title: England v India: KL Rahul century helps tourists take control at Lord's
item.description: England suffer a demoralising first day of the second Test as an unbeaten KL Rahul century leads India towards a huge total at Lord's.

item.title: Virgil van Dijk: Liverpool defender signs deal until 2025
item.description: Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk extends his contract with the club until 2025.

item.title: Super League: St Helens 10-20 Castleford Tigers - Cas win to end 31-year wait
item.description: Castleford Tigers stun 12-man champions St Helens and secure a first league win at Saints since October 1990.

item.title: John Simpson stars as Superchargers pile up The Hundred's first 200
item.description: Northern Superchargers rack up 200 in an incredible 69-run win over Manchester Originals as the visitors wilt at a raucous Headingley.

item.title: Romelu Lukaku: Chelsea re-sign Belgium striker from Inter Milan for a club record £97.5m
item.description: Chelsea have re-signed Belgium striker Romelu Lukaku from Inter Milan for £97.5m.
